indexText: MathOnWeb is an open source web application that executes complex math operations. Therefore it must be very fast to provide an acceptable user experience. This is the reason why it does not use a virtualDOM like React. It uses the default DOM of ES6, supported by the most modern browsers natively. It does not use any type of virtualization. Furthermore it uses Typescript, which is typesafe and has some performance improvements. I would appreciate it, if you suppport this project on

general.experimental-text: This feature is still experimental! So there are big performance issues and the results are not 100% trustable.

faculty.title: faculty calculator
faculty.description: calculates the faculty of a value

logarithm.title: logarithm calculator
logarithm.description: calculates the logarithm of a number

angle-calculator.title: Vector angle calculator
angle-calculator.description: Calculates the angle between to vectors

linear-dependency.title: Vector linear dependency
linear-dependency.description: checks if two vectors are linear dependent

is-vector-on-line.title: Is vector on line
is-vector-on-line.description: Checks if a vector is on a line

get-vector-line.title: Get vector line
get-vector-line.description: Creates a vector line from the given points

triangle-angle-calculator.title: Triangle angle calculator
triangle-angle-calculator.description: Calcualtes all angles of a triangle

layer-type-converter.title: Layer type converter
layer-type-converter.description: Converts a vector layer between the two different types

4-field-table.title: 4 Field table completer
4-field-table.description: Completes a 4 field table, if enough values are given
